posts.post_content:
RAFIQ! He's probably the best Exalted Creature out there (Though Battlegrace Angel isn't far behind) and is pretty much a must-play in any bant deck.
  
Turn 1: Noble Hierarch
  
Turn 2: Rhox War Monk
  
Turn 3: Rafiq of the Many, swing with a 5/6 double striker with lifelink...
  
Turn 4: Battlegrace Angel, swing with a 6/7 double striker with double lifelink...
  
Yeah.
posts.html:

Yeah.

Posted By: MetalCrisis (4/21/2009 4:34:59 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: He needed to be a 3/4 to really be good. I really do not like him outside a very aggressive Bant deck. In midrange and control he doesn't help you unless you're already winning. Also he's a horrible topdeck. I'd much rather play a [Chameleon Colossus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Chameleon Colossus).

posts.post_content: Rafig Owns. Rhox war monk Rafiq of the many 6 damage each turn. Your pretty much dead. It give creature first strike its just a nice card all togther. It might be a terrible top deck but its undoubtedly a finisher. Combined it with any reasonable card and you have won.

posts.post_content:
bad topdeck??? only if theres one in play. Even then I know I can attack with my in-play rafiq no matter what then cast another.
  
   
this is my take
  
T1 noble
  
T2 shorecrasher mimic
  
T3 favor of the overbeing (swing for 8 in the air vigilance trample)
  
T4 Rafiq (swing for 18)
  
   
I know rhox is amazing but I love trample, more likely to finish the game right there.

posts.post_content: Nice Card, awesome with evaders and his effect can kick in on the turn he comes in. He basically turns any creature into a double striker. He will turn any crappy evasion or even a *deathtouch* creature into a beast.

posts.post_content: Rafiq is such an awesome Bant aggro card, it's just that he's so expensive and hard to find, same with Noble Hierarch. He's so expensive because he and Noble Hierarch are used in almost every Bant aggro deck that wins a lot and their value keeps going up. I'll never get those two. :(

posts.post_content:
This card combined with Knotvine Paladin and one or two other exalted creatures out on the field at once can do some crazy, stupid damage. Combine Rafiq, Knotvine Paladin, and Finest hour?  
  
You could win in one turn lol. Rafiq might be my favorite card ever printed, just because he has so much versatility in an exalted deck; he builds your monsters up, and he builds them up fast.
